designations.source: A review of the status of the beetles of Great Britain: The stag beetles, dor beetles, dung beetles, chafers and their allies - Lucanidae, Geotrupidae, Trogidae and Scarabaeidae
designations.source_description: This report was commissioned to update the national threat status of beetles within the Lucanidae, Geotrupidae, Trogidae and Scarabaeidae. It covers all species in these groups, identifying those that are rare and/or under threat as well as non-threatened and nonnative species. Reviews for other invertebrate groups will follow.
designations.reporting_category: Red listing based on 2001 IUCN guidelines
designations.designation_description: Taxa which are neither threatened nor near threatened.
designations.comments: Within its main range there is evidence of recent range contraction. For example, the vice-counties of Surrey and Middlesex supported the species in 8 hectads in the first recording period and none in the second – the last record being from 1989. Ongoing decline in terms of range contraction is suspected but difficult to prove throughout its range and under recording is likely. The species is susceptible to a range of plausible threats including change in land use and development, the use of endectocides and changes in grazing regimes and practices, affecting the availability and continuity of a dung supply. Whilst IUCN Categories do not apply, the species is close to a regional designation of Near Threatened.
